---
title: "External Resources"
subtitle: "List of resources for learning more about open source geospatial tools in Python"

## Workflow resources
* [Git - for managing code versions](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/quickstart/github-flow)
* [Conda - for managing dependencies](https://docs.conda.io/en/latest/)
* [Jupyter - for running code](https://jupyter.org)

## Geospatial courses/books
* [Data Carpentry geospatial course](https://datacarpentry.org/geospatial-workshop/)
* [UW course on Geospatial Data Analysis with Python](https://uwgda-jupyterbook.readthedocs.io/)
* [Geographic data book - emphasis on vector data](https://geographicdata.science/book/intro.html)

## Geospatial docs
* [Project Pythia - Pangeo's education hub](https://projectpythia.org/)
* [Planetary Computer](https://planetarycomputer.microsoft.com/docs/overview/about)
* [Geospatial Computing Platform library of training resources (by Python package)](https://crib.utwente.nl/manual/training-resources/README.html)

## Materials from hack weeks
* [UW GeoHackWeek](https://github.com/geohackweek)
* [UW OceanHackWeek](https://github.com/oceanhackweek/)

## Blogs
* [Blog series on latest trends and resources in geospatial - entry-level](https://medium.com/@shakasom)
